Legal_Issue: Whether the Refugee Division violated the applicant's right to procedural fairness
Application_Facts: The panel concluded the hearing prematurely without allowing counsel to respond to credibility concerns
Court_Ruling: Decision quashed, new hearing ordered with a different panel
Defendant_Behavior: Refugee Division failed to allow representations before decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of opportunity to present case fully, procedural unfairness
Legal_Standard: Principles of natural justice and s. 69(5) of the Immigration Act
Assessment_Factor: Credibility doubts raised without response opportunity
Procedural_Issue: Failure to allow representations prior to decision
Credibility_Assessment: Doubts expressed by panel without allowing rebuttal
Application_Basis: Alleged breach of procedural rights in refugee determination process
Evidence_Assessed: Previous hearing record, excluding prejudicial comments
Governing_Rule: Right to make representations under s. 69(5)
Evidentiary_Deficiency: No opportunity to address credibility concerns
Harm_Assessment: Denial of fair hearing impacted right to full representation
Cause_Description: Applicant challenged decision due to procedural unfairness
Evidence_Handling: Prior evidence admissible except for specific prejudicial remarks
Evidence_Issues: Exclusion of prejudicial comments from re-hearing
Evidence_Assessment: Panel did not permit final representations on credibility
Decision_Rationale: Violation of procedural fairness requires new hearing
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to allow response to adverse credibility findings
Legal_Standard_Applied: Natural justice, right to be heard (audi alteram partem)
